cases.Use a few words, avoid common phrases: Use a few words, avoid common phrases
cases.No need for symbols, digits, or uppercas: No need for symbols, digits, or uppercase letters
cases.Add another word or two. Uncommon words: Add another word or two. Uncommon words are better.
cases.Straight rows of keys are easy to guess: Straight rows of keys are easy to guess
cases.Short keyboard patterns are easy to gues: Short keyboard patterns are easy to guess
cases.Use a longer keyboard pattern with more: Use a longer keyboard pattern with more turns
cases.Repeats like \"aaa\" are easy to guess: Repeats like "aaa" are easy to guess
cases.Repeats like \"abcabcabc\" are only slig: Repeats like "abcabcabc" are only slightly harder to guess than "abc"
cases.Sequences like abc or 6543 are easy to g: Sequences like abc or 6543 are easy to guess
cases.Recent years are easy to guess: Recent years are easy to guess
cases.Dates are often easy to guess: Dates are often easy to guess
cases.Avoid years that are associated with you: Avoid years that are associated with you
cases.Avoid dates and years that are associate: Avoid dates and years that are associated with you
cases.This is similar to a commonly used passw: This is similar to a commonly used password
cases.This is a top-10 common password: This is a top-10 common password
cases.This is a top-100 common password: This is a top-100 common password
cases.This is a very common password: This is a very common password
cases.A word by itself is easy to guess: A word by itself is easy to guess
cases.Names and surnames by themselves are eas: Names and surnames by themselves are easy to guess
cases.Common names and surnames are easy to gu: Common names and surnames are easy to guess
cases.All-uppercase is almost as easy to guess: All-uppercase is almost as easy to guess as all-lowercase
cases.Reversed words aren't much harder to gue: Reversed words aren't much harder to guess
cases.Predictable substitutions like \"@\" ins: Predictable substitutions like "@" instead of "a"s don't help very much

crack.subtitle: Time to crack this password on an ordinary computer.

section1.title: The importance of a safe password
section1.subtitle: Why do you need to use a password security checker and why is it important to periodically update or improve your passwords? Simply put, not all passwords are created equal. Some passwords are stronger than others.

section2.title: What is a strong password?
section2.subtitle: A strong password follows several rules and best practices making it more difficult to crack. A secure password should:
tips: Have a minimum length of 8 characters
Not contain 3 or more consecutive characters

section3.title: Protect your privacy with our secure password checker
section3.subtitle: Wondering “how secure is my password” or “will I pass a password test?”. Our free and secure password checker was designed to analyze, rate, and improve your passwords. With our tool, you can easily:
features: Analyze the complexity and character combination of your password
Determine the uniqueness of your password
Display how much time it would likely take to crack your password
Confirm your password meets all strong password requirements

section4.title: How safe is our online password checker?
section4.subtitle1: It’s important to make sure that the online password checker you want to use is from a respected cyber security company. Before running any password manager, password checker, or password generator, check carefully that the website address is trusted and reliable.

subtitle2.part1: All Internxt products and services are designed to put the user first above all else. Our password checker, just like our cloud services, is 100%

section5.title: Why trust Internxt’s password security checker?

subtitle1.part1: At Internxt, we create secure, encrypted, zero-knowledge technologies. All our services are developed with users’
subtitle1.part2: in mind and all of our services are built to keep your data safe.

section5.subtitle2: We believe our password checker, along with our other free resources, online tools, and cloud storage services, should serve a free society and allow all persons to pursue excellence without fear for their digital security.

subtitle3.part1: We do not store user data. We don’t make money from hosting ads or trading user data. We end-to-end encrypt all information uploaded to the Internxt cloud before it ever leaves a user’s device.

description.line1: Everithing you store is encrypted with
description.line2: the most complex and secure algorithms.
description.line3: Your data is only accessible by you.

ToolsSection.title: Try out other Internxt's free online security tools:

faq.question: How secure is my password with Internxt’s free tool?
answer: With Internxt’s password security checker, you can test your password and be sure that it is as secure as it can possibly be. Also, all passwords entered into our security password checker are not saved or stored in any way, leaving them safe to use for any of your accounts.

faq.question: How strong is my password?
answer: Generally, the longer and more complex, meaning the more different numbers, letters, and characters, the better. Type in your password in our Password Checker and find out!

faq.question: How to create a strong password?
answer: Follow the rules listed above or check out our article explaining [how to create strong passwords](https://blog.internxt.com/how-to-create-a-strong-password/). If you're still having trouble coming up with a good password, find a legitimate random password generator and let a trusted service do it for you. Just, be sure to remember the password it creates for you.

faq.question: How to check my password security?
answer: With Internxt’s Password Checker, you can test your password and be sure it is as secure as possible. Type in your password in our Password Checker and find out!

faq.question: How safe is Internxt’s Password Checker?
answer: With Internxt’s password security checker, you can test your password and be sure it is as secure as possible. Also, all passwords entered into our Password Checker are not saved or stored in any way, leaving them safe to use for any of your accounts.

faq.question: How to manage and remember complex passwords?
answer: Look into downloading a trusted password manager to manage all your passwords for you. Some browsers have password-saving and password-generator features included as well.

faq.question: What is an example of a strong password?
answer: A good example of a strong password is **fG,P6tQnRz-Ur$a**. The password is not easy to remember, but it is extremely difficult to crack. Password managers can help you create and manage strong passwords.
